meanings.definition: Toward a higher place or position
meanings.sent1: She climbed up the stairs to reach the top.
meanings.sent2: The balloon floated up into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to jump up onto the shelf but missed.
meanings.sent4: His spirits lifted up like a helium balloon.
meanings.sent5: The kite soared up with the wind.

meanings.definition: In a direction opposite to the ground
meanings.sent1: The bird flew up into the tree.
meanings.sent2: The elevator moved up to the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scampered up the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: Her mood lifted up like a rising sun.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon ascended up gracefully.

meanings.sent1: The puzzle was all done up in record time.
meanings.sent2: The project was wrapped up before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cake was baked up to perfection.
meanings.sent4: The story had a neatly tied up ending.
meanings.sent5: The painting was beautifully finished up with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: In a state of excitement or readiness
meanings.sent1: The kids were all fired up for the field trip.
meanings.sent2: She was amped up for the big game.
meanings.sent3: The crowd was hyped up for the concert.
meanings.sent4: His energy levels were revved up like a sports car.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere was charged up with anticipation.

meanings.sent1: The storm was picking up speed as it approached.
meanings.sent2: The excitement was building up as the event neared.
meanings.sent3: The volume was cranked up to the maximum.
meanings.sent4: The tension was ramping up like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The heat was rising up steadily throughout the day.
